description: As the fight against climate change comes under attack from France to the United States, it is more urgent than ever to generate new momentum with messages that highlight the benefits of energy transition and the real cost of inaction.

headline: In South Korea, fans celebrate end of military service for K-pop's BTS
description: The mandatory military service of the members of the world's most famous K-pop group sparked intense debate in South Korea, even leading to the adoption of a law allowing stars to postpone enlistment until age 30 to protect their careers.

headline: Venice locals protest three-day Jeff Bezos wedding extravaganza
description: Residents of La Serenissima have formed a group to oppose the wedding of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez, who have planned a ceremony set to take place between Thursday and Saturday.

headline: For Gulf monarchies, Israel has replaced Iran as Middle East's main destabilizing force
description: Israel's increasingly aggressive stance has sparked anxiety and anger in the palaces of the Arabian Peninsula. Elites in the region, who fear reprisals against US military bases on their soil, have called for a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue.

description: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

headline: US attacks Iran, thrusting Middle East war into total uncertainty
description: After pretending to hesitate, Donald Trump took a historic risk by deciding to bomb three Iranian nuclear sites, without congressional authorization. While all eyes are turning to Iran, Israel finds itself with a rare opportunity to bring down the regime in Tehran.

headline: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
description: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.
